alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Louisa; Van Buren; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 8:24AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Henderson, western Mercer, Henry, Des Moines, northeastern Van Buren, Louisa, southeastern Washington, southwestern Muscatine, southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Lee Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 824 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lockridge to near Franklin. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Pleasant and Westwood around 830 AM CDT. Wayland, Lowell and Denmark around 835 AM CDT. New London, Danville, Middletown and Olds around 840 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Winfield, Crawfordsville, Wyman, Columbus Junction, Mediapolis, Morning Sun, Columbus City, Cotter, Grandview, Amber, New Boston, Letts, Oakville and Toolesboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Louisa; Van Buren; Washington
